channel.title: New update doesnt show up?!
channel.description:
always if i update something like new shop and etc...
i compile but nothing happens in game!
Compiling... javac: file not found: src\com\rs\*.java Usage: javac <options> <source files> use -help for a list of possible options Finished. Druk op een toets om door te gaan. . . thats what i sais help me?!

item.title: New update doesnt show up?!
item.dc:creator: @wildskiller wildskiller
item.description:
@wildskiller wrote:

This is why you need an IDE.

Read full topic

item.title: New update doesnt show up?!
item.dc:creator: @iHype iHype
item.description:
@iHype wrote:

[quote=“ownerbasgar, post:1, topic:450040”]always if i update something like new shop and etc…

i compile but nothing happens in game!

Compiling…
javac: file not found: src\com\rs*.java
Usage: javac
use -help for a list of possible options
Finished.
Druk op een toets om door te gaan. . . thats what i sais help me?![/quote]

The compiler can’t find your Java directory.

Read full topic

item.title: New update doesnt show up?!
item.dc:creator: @Dan0194 Dan0194
item.description:
@Dan0194 wrote:

No Problem

Read full topic

item.title: New update doesnt show up?!
item.dc:creator: @ownerbasgar ownerbasgar
item.description:
@ownerbasgar wrote:

[quote=“DAn0194, post:4, topic:450040”]There right ^ you dont need to compile for .cfg files but If you want your compiler to work just:

  1. Open Up Computer

  2. Go to C Drive

  3. Open Program Files

  4. Go to Java

  5. Find your jdk.

  6. Open Up Jdk > open up bin.

  7. Copy the url at the top.

  8. Paste it where I tell you to on the code below:

@echo off title Compiler "(PUT YOUR CODE HERE)\javac.exe" -cp . *.java pause[/quote] Awesome thanks

Read full topic

item.title: New update doesnt show up?!
item.dc:creator: @kingman002 kingman002
item.description:
@kingman002 wrote:

[quote=“DAn0194, post:4, topic:450040”]There right ^ you dont need to compile for .cfg files but If you want your compiler to work just:

  1. Open Up Computer

  2. Go to C Drive

  3. Open Program Files

  4. Go to Java

  5. Find your jdk.

  6. Open Up Jdk > open up bin.

  7. Copy the url at the top.

  8. Paste it where I tell you to on the code below:

@echo off title Compiler "(PUT YOUR CODE HERE)\javac.exe" -cp . *.java pause[/quote]
His compiler is fine for the most part. he just needs to set the path to the java files

Read full topic

item.title: New update doesnt show up?!
item.dc:creator: @Dan0194 Dan0194
item.description:
@Dan0194 wrote:

There right ^ you dont need to compile for .cfg files but If you want your compiler to work just:

  1. Open Up Computer

  2. Go to C Drive

  3. Open Program Files

  4. Go to Java

  5. Find your jdk.

  6. Open Up Jdk > open up bin.

  7. Copy the url at the top.

  8. Paste it where I tell you to on the code below:

@echo off title Compiler "(PUT YOUR CODE HERE)\javac.exe" -cp . *.java pause

Read full topic

item.title: New update doesnt show up?!
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

It’s your compiler.

But also, ghostly150 is right. You don’t need to compile for a .cfg.

Read full topic

item.title: New update doesnt show up?!
item.dc:creator: @ghostly150 ghostly150
item.description:
@ghostly150 wrote:

If it’s a shop, and the shop is a .cfg file then you shouldn’t need to compile (along with other .cfg files). You just have to make sure you actually hit ‘save’ to save the file and then run the server.

Also, for that error, the java compiler cannot locate your .java files. Check if the comand line path to them is accurate.

Read full topic
